website_summaries.verdict: A great equipment addition for pros and beginners alike, this neon yellow snorkel vest makes it easy to stay visible while out on the water.
pros: Removable strap fits securely around the waist and crotch to keep vest from riding up when it's inflated
Quick-release valve allows for fast deflation
Some over 200 pounds say it fits comfortably
cons: Straps might take some time to adjust
If not done correctly, vest will ride up and obstruct face

customer_reviews.title: XL is great for plus size women
customer_reviews.text: The XL works for me! I am a large short woman. 5'3 and 240 pounds and this size is perfect for me. Tried on and inflated but haven't gone on vacation yet with it. Seems like it will work just fine. Easy to inflate and nice long straps. Stayed inflated when I tried it. My only reason for 4 not 5 stars is because it doesn't come with a bag. My daughters seal buddy snorkel vest came with a nice mesh carry bag. That would have been a great added item for this. Otherwise it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Would be great for a large person when snorkelling and its unintentional deflation would not possibly be life-threatening.
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a hookah unit to scrape the props and rudders of my boat. Inflation is easy and adjustable. This is an extra large floatation device. A small person may have problems because of its size. I didn't need a regular robust scuba buoyancy compensator, so this was an excellent choice for the price. I would not use it for scuba as it may be easily cut by oyster shells, barnacles and the like, as it is just an unprotected vinyl air chamber.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scuba Choice Adult Neon Yellow Snorkel Vest with Name Box
customer_reviews.text: Super glad I had my own vest and it WAS NEEDED in the ocean where we were at. It was nice that we did not match the others on our excursion (made it easier to find each other). I was on the borderline for weight so bought the XL to be safe, but really should have gotten the Large, as the XL was a tad too big for me. Still glad I had it. No issues with using it for 12 days.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: This worked fine. I was snorkeling out on a reef a ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine. I was snorkeling out on a reef a couple hundred yards off shore. The wind and current were fairly strong. Without it I would not have been able to go out. I highly recommend wearing one of these. You can deflate to dive under if you want, then blow up when you surface. This thing takes up very little space to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Clint L. Livingston

customer_reviews.title: He is not the best swimmer and felt very comfortable and safe with this ...

He was in the water for about 5 minutes before he went back on the boat and begged the captain to let him wear his own vest (this one)!
